data.text: Contents
Introduction

The Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust (The Trust) wishes to ensure that non training grade junior medical and dental staff are given appropriate and reasonable financial support when they are required to change their place of residence as a result of accepting a post with the Trust.

The Trust is committed to ensure that this policy is applied fairly to all eligible employees and it should be read in conjunction with the Equality, diversity and inclusion policy (MSEPO-21049); and the Recruitment and selection policy (MSEPO-21123).
Scope

The purpose of this policy is to outline the conditions of eligibility and the type of expenses that may be claimed for. It also sets out the terms under which relocation expenses and associated costs incurred by non-training grade junior medical and dental staff may be reimbursed. It should not be read as indicating any form of settlement.
Aims
The aims of this policy are:
To support the recruitment of high calibre staff

To provide a framework for the allocation of reasonable financial support to new junior medical and dental staff required to change their place of residence as a result of accepting employment with the Trust.
To ensure this support is applied fairly, equitably and consistently.
General conditions
The application from this policy will depends on the individual circumstances. Removal and associated costs will be paid for a single move and only when the Trust is satisfied that:
The removal of the employees home is required
The arrangements proposed are reasonable
The expenses incurred are deemed as necessary
The grant of relocation assistance should be agreed by the Clinical Director/Clinical Lead and Senior Manager of the service at the start of the recruitment process

The request must be submitted within 3 months of commencement in post. Employees wishing to claim for reimbursement of expenses must complete a Relocation Expenses Claim Form (Appendix 1). The Trust will not accept liability for any costs incurred prior to approval.
NB: The Trust reserves the right not to reimburse claims, which have not been approved as above.
Relocation and associated expenses will not be payable to an employee if they are recoverable from another source e.g. partner's employer.
Employees who relocate from overseas will only be eligible to claim for expenses from the port of entry into the UK.
Reimbursement will only be made after the employee commences employment with the Trust.

The maximum amount payable to an individual employee shall not exceed the amounts outlined in section 7.2. However, the level of support will be agreed on an individual basis, and will only be paid for eligible expenses as determined on the Relocation Expenses Claim Form.
Eligibility

This policy applies to MSE Staff on rotational placements or recruited by the Trust for positions of more than 6 months. For shorter periods reasonable reimbursement of the cost of removal of personal effects, plus travelling expenses during the preliminary search for accommodation will be payable.

This policy does not apply to Doctors in Training who should refer to the Health Education England Policy, Relocation and Travel Expenses for Doctors and Dentists in Training and Public Health trainees

Eligibility will be determined by the appropriate Clinical/Executive Director or General Manager prior to any financial liability being incurred, and will set in advance the maximum total relocation and associated costs payable. This amount may vary from post to post, and will be subject to the agreement of the / Director of Workforce Services and Strategic Workforce Planning

All claims must typically be made within 3 months from the date of commencement during which the employee should be able to prove they are actively searching for new residence. However, in exceptional circumstances; family emergency and sickness, the appropriate Clinical/Executive Director or Senior Manager has the discretion to extend this period to a maximum period of 1 year.

At the date of appointment the employee must live more than 50 miles from the contracted work base or, for those who partake in on call rotas, beyond contractually required travel times. The proposed move must be within  miles of the new primary place of work or, for those who partake in on call rotas, within contractually required travel times.
Repayment conditions

Employees will be expected to give a signed undertaking to refund the monies received should they voluntarily terminate their employment or be dismissed for reasons of misconduct within specific timeframes as per section 6.2.
Repayment will be required as follows:

table_items.text: Period within which the employee leaves the Trust

data.text: Financial support available

Financial support will only be provided for those costs, which have been actually and necessarily incurred by the employee as a result of changing their residence in order to take up an offer of employment with the Trust.
Payment of expenses will be proportionate to length of appointment, subject to the following amounts:
This applies to rotational placements.

All expenses claimed must be supported by receipts and quotations as appropriate e.g. train tickets. The Trust will check the validity of the receipts and will not reimburse any amounts that are not receipted.
Typical costs that may be reimbursed are:
Property sale/purchase
Any sale / purchase of a property covered under the policy may also include reimbursement of the following vouched legal expenses:
Sale – solicitor fees, estate agent fees
Purchase – solicitor fees, stamp duty, land fees, survey fees
Temporary accommodation
Where an employee has vacated rented accommodation in the old area they may be reimbursed for:
Revocation of tenancy agreement

If an employee moves into temporary accommodation in the new area they may be reimbursed for the rental of this accommodation. Reimbursement for this may only be claimed for a maximum period of 6 months and will be considered part of the total relocation allowance.
Costs incurred by renting Trust accommodation will be deducted from the employee's salary, but may be reimbursed under this policy.
Removal and storage costs

Estimates of cost of the removal must be approved by the Trust. When furniture and effects are to be removed by contractors, 3 competitive tenders, in writing, must be obtained by the employee. The Trust will reimburse, subject to approval, the lowest tender submitted although the employee has the discretion to use any of these tender.
Employees may be reimbursed for any reasonable costs associated with:
The cost of removal of furniture and effects belonging to the employee or dependent members of the household at the time of transfer from the old home to the new home.
The cost of removal from the old home to temporary storage facilities (locally) and then the transfer to the new home.
Charges for temporary storage will only be reimbursed where despite removal the new accommodation is not ready for occupancy. Such expenses will only be reimbursed for a maximum of 1 year.
The employee may choose to move furniture and effects themselves. In such cases, actual receipted costs of van hire must be provided.
Preliminary visits
Expenses for up to two preliminary visits to the area when searching for new accommodation will be reimbursed.
Travel in lieu of relocation

Where an employee would normally qualify for removal expenses but is unable to move home immediately either because suitable accommodation cannot be found or for reasons approved by the Clinical/ Executive Director or Senior Manager, the Trust may determine to reimburse for excess daily travel for an agreed period of time.
All costs reimbursed for excess daily travel will be considered part of the total relocation allowance
The mileage that may be paid in these circumstances is the difference between the mileage from home to the previous place of work and the mileage from home to the new place of work.
Mileage will be paid at the public transport rate as determined by the appropriate Terms and Conditions of Service, and must be claimed monthly.
Continuing commitments
Assistance may be provided for employees who unavoidably incur regular expenses in respect of accommodation they previously occupied, concurrently with accommodation expenses in the new area,
The allowance payable under this heading will be the lesser of:
The continuing expenses of the previous accommodation or
The accommodation expenses incurred in the new area
All costs reimbursed will be considered part of the total relocation allowance.

Continuing commitments will only be reimbursed if the Trust is satisfied that the employee is actively marketing their old property, including a price reduction if appropriate, or that they have a good reason not to relocate immediately e.g. partner's employment. This decision will be approved only by the Workforce Services and Strategic Workforce Planning after discussions with the Executive/Clinical Director or General Manager.
The employee's eligibility to claim for reimbursement of continuing commitments will be reviewed on a quarterly basis.
Reimbursement for continuing commitments will be for a maximum period of 6 months and will be paid in arrears.
Taxation of expenses

Income Revenue regulations state that any qualifying removal expenses in excess of £8,000 per move are subject to income tax. Expenses reimbursed under this agreement may therefore be subject to tax liability and declaration to the Inland Revenue.
Fraudulent claims
All claims and receipts will be checked for validity. Where the claim is suspected to be fraudulent it will be referred to the NHS Counter Fraud Office for further investigation.
Appeals procedure

Relocation claims will not be unreasonably refused. An employee who is aggrieved at the decision taken regarding relocation expenses may pursue his/her grievance through the Trust Grievance Procedure.
Monitoring and audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points.

table_items.text: Aspect of compliance or effectiveness being monitored

Director of Workforce Services and Strategic Workforce Planning
Compliance with relocation payments made to employee in line with HMRC guidelines
Submission of eligible expenses and payment of reimbursements

data.text: Approval and implementation

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by the HR Policy Working Group which is the specialist group with the authority to approve local policies and guidelines. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.
It is the author's responsibility to inform the relevant audience of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Equality impact assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible
and meets the needs of all individuals. (Refer to Appendix 2)
The Trust aim is to design and implement services, policies, procedures,
needs of our service, population and workforce, ensuring that none are
placed at a disadvantage over others.
In order to meet these requirements, an equality impact assessment is used
to assess all its policies, procedures and practices. This procedure was
found to be compliant with this assessment.

house sale   Y/N
house purchase  Y/N
removal from old to new accommodation  Y/N
removal from store to new accommodation  Y/N
Written receipts (on company headed paper) must be provided for all actual and necessary costs claimed for. These will be checked for validity.
